medical_history.chief_complaint: Gross hematuria and a mass in the bladder.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 6 weeks earlier when painless hematuria developed with passage of clots while traveling. After 2 days, he sought medical attention with persistent bleeding. Over the course, he underwent multiple evaluations, leading to the diagnosis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of lower urinary tract symptoms and urinary retention; previously underwent transurethral resection of the prostate 12 years prior. History of erectile dysfunction, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, diverticulosis, mild obstructive sleep apnea, and nephrolithiasis treated with lithotripsy.
medical_history.social_history: Retired from the shipping industry with exposure to asbestos; physically active in outdoor activities; does not smoke or drink alcohol.
